purpose: To educate and provide a foundational understanding of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) through practical examples in various programming languages.
principle: Leverages a multi-language approach to demonstrate MCP concepts, offering examples and exercises in .NET, Java, TypeScript, JavaScript, and Python.
reusability: Modular curriculum with examples in multiple languages, suitable for integration into educational programs or self-paced learning.
limitations: Primarily focused on introductory concepts; may not cover advanced MCP use cases or integrations.
name: mcp-for-beginners
description: This open-source curriculum is designed to teach the concepts and fundamentals of the Model Context Protocol (MCP), with practical examples in .NET, Java, TypeScript, JavaScript and Python.
highlight: Comprehensive curriculum for learning the Model Context Protocol (MCP) across multiple programming languages.
